Package pract5

Class DateTime

java.lang.Object
pract5.DateTime
public class DateTime extends Object
Class DateTime allows to represent a timeStamp of a precise date (day, month and year).
Version:
Academic Year 2023-24
Author:
IIP

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DateTime(int d, int m, int y)
    Create a new DateTime with the given values of day, month, and year (assuming they are correct) and the current UTC instant.
    DateTime(int d, int m, int y, int hour, int min)
    Create a new DateTime with the given values of day, month, year, hours, and minutes, (assuming they are correct)

      public DateTime(int d, int m, int y)

      m - int mes del DateTime.
      y - int anyo del DateTime.

    • equals

      public boolean equals(Object o)
      Check the equality of the current DateTime with the given Object o.
      Overrides:
      equals in class Object
      Parameters:
      o - Object.
      Returns:
      boolean, true if o is a Date time and instant, day, month, and day are the same of the current DateTime. false otherwise.

    • compareTo

      public int compareTo(DateTime d)
      Chronologically compares the current DateTime with a given DateTime.
      Parameters:
      d - reference to an object of class DateTime to compare with the current DateTime.
      Returns:
      int,returns a negative, positive or zero value if the current DateTime is, respectively, earlier, later or equal to the given DateTime.

    • isLeap

      public static boolean isLeap(int year)
      Checks if a given year is a leap year.
      Parameters:
      year - int the year.
      Returns:
      boolean, returns true if the year is a leap year. and false otherwise.

    • isCorrect

      public static boolean isCorrect(int hours, int min, int day, int month, int year)
      Checks whether the given hours, minutes, day, month and year data correspond to a correct time and date.
      Parameters:
      hours - int the hours.
      min - int the minutes.
      day - int the day.
      month - int the month.
      year - int the year.
      Returns:
      boolean, returns true if the data is correct. and false otherwise.
